description: One of Minsk's most beautiful places, the Loshitsa estate dates to the 15th century with its heyday in the late 19th century under the Lubansky family. The Art Nouveau manor house with neo-Gothic elements sits within a stunning 100-hectare park along the Svisloch River, featuring restored interiors, ancient alleys, and the legendary 'engagement oak.'
highlights: Art Nouveau manor with classicism and neo-Gothic elements
Fully restored museum interiors with authentic furniture
Ruins of family chapel, stone mill, and brewery
Former orchard with rare Manchu apricots
Cultural center hosting Lositsky festivals and knight tournaments
tips: Museum shows life of 19th-century Belarusian nobility
Perfect for leisurely walks along ancient alleys
Visit the 'engagement oak' for tradition and photos
Check schedule for festivals and knight tournaments
Allow 2-3 hours to explore estate and park
Picturesque in all seasons, especially autumn
vibe: Romantic, tranquil, timelessly beautiful - an aristocratic oasis where elegant history and natural splendor intertwine to create Minsk's most enchanting escape
